page.title: 03EDUCATION IN TYWARDREATH
page.content: You can go to{playgroup}at the age of 3+ to 4+. Then you come to this { {Primary School}from the age of 4+ to 11+. A Primary School is the most important school where you learn to read and write. We have 10 classes, 11 teachers, 2 helpers and a Headmaster. One helper is an Auxiliary who helps with the Rising Fives and the other is an Ancillary who helps Statement Children. The younger children, 4+ to 5, come half a day, some in the afternoon and the others in the morning. When you are 11+ you move on to Fowey{ {Comprehensive School}. You do your exams there so you can get a job. When you are 16+ you leave or go to { {St. Austell VIth Form College}or{Mid {Cornwall College of Further Education. At this school we have 314 pupils.
